In this paragraph, the mentioned diseases are described in detail:

1. Benign breast: This term refers to non-cancerous breast tissue.
2. Invasive lobular cancers: This is a type of breast cancer where cancer cells invade the lobules (milk-producing glands) and can spread to other parts of the body.
3. Low-grade ductal carcinomas: This is a type of breast cancer that grows slowly and has less aggressive characteristics compared to high-grade ductal carcinomas. It develops in the milk ducts of the breast.
